intro: Corydalis wuzhengyiana, commonly known as the Wuzheng yin corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces small, elongated seed pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
